description: Try our easy to follow Tobie Puttock's Royal Gala Apple Strudel recipe. Absolutely delicious with the best ingredients from Woolworths.
name: Tobie Puttock's Royal Gala Apple Strudel Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 700g royal gala apples, peeled, cored, thinly sliced

recipeInstructions.text: Soak the raisins in the rum or brandy. Preheat oven to 180Â°C and grease a large baking tray with a little oil.

Put the flour, salt, olive oil and one egg into a large mixing bowl with 1/3 cup of warm water. Using your hands, mix the ingredients together to form a soft dough. turn the dough out onto a clean, flour-dusted surface, then knead until smooth and elastic. Cover and put to one side.
Wipe out the mixing bowl. Place the rum-soaked raisins, apples, almonds, caster sugar, cinnamon and lemon juice in the bowl and fold to combine. Put to one side.
Roll the dough on the floured surface. Aim for a thickness of around 3mm. If the dough bunches up around the edges, trim with a sharp knife.

Scatter breadcrumbs across the dough, then spread apple mixture evenly. Roll the dough to form a classic strudel shape - plump and elongated. Secure the ends by folding pastry over on itself, like an envelope. Place strudel on baking tray.
Beat the remaining egg in a small bow, then glaze the pastry.
Bake for 30 minutes until the pastry turns golden brown.
Dust with icing sugar. Serve hot with ice cream.
